intro: Tephrosia icthyneca, commonly known as the African senna, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and savannas. Its seeds are encased in a hard pod, and the plant is known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine. Tephrosia icthyneca is also used in soil conservation due to its ability to fix nitrogen.
